alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 1:56PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Dolores and northwestern Montezuma Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 155 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Dove Creek, or 36 miles southeast of Monticello, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Dolores and northwestern Montezuma Counties, including the following locations... Cahone. This includes U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 43 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
